header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Daily Routine; vices – cigarettes and alcohol; common sense vs. intelligence; different cultures/feminism
header.activity: Husband and wife sitting on the sofa talking about various real and hypothetical situations
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, complaining, anecdote telling

body.u: okay so we're recording now?
yep
okay so tell me about your day cos you haven't done that yet
oh well I think it was raining on the way it was a bit miserable eh but it cheered up a lot this afternoon and then when I was there the day went past pretty quickly and I did eh
did you have to deal with ?
no
well that was lucky
yeah it was good I did a useful errand though I went to Sainsbury and got some milk that was my I got some money out of the kitty

and em bought some milk for the tea
well just for oh okay
well no it's shared milk if you get em the milk there's a shared pot of money but it goes in the fridge

and even if we're fifty people em well because there are fifty you'll find it doesn't last very long

em no I went to the gym and em then I went swimming and em so I didn't after that I didn't want to go to em shops with wet hair and we didn't really need anything so no I didn't

that was that okay so shall I ask you one of these questions?

okay which vice would you indulge in if it had no side effects?
smoking
why?
because it's lovely
In what way is it lovely?

well you know if you are ever feeling a bit stressed you go you can have a nice cigarette and it calms you all down although it actually stresses the body but it relaxes the mind and you can em eh get an excuse to go outside as well and have a chat with people and get away from from the desk
mm
but it isn't very good for your health
it isn't but even before the smoking ban came in there were lots of places who chose not to have they chose to be non-smoking wasn't that a pain to have to go outside all the time?
eh well I'd already stopped before the ban came in so it didn't really affect me
ah okay but how do you I mean if you are a non smoker you s smoke smells horrible if someone blows smoke in your face it tastes horrible how do you get past that?
how do you how did you get past it?
well what I mean is that your first for most people the first taste of cigarette is horrible
yeah it's just to push past it
I know but why would you push past it?
oh I see I see em well I first smoked a pipe which is a bit unusual but that was very strong it nearly made me sick when I first tried it but I thought I'd be like Sherlock Holmes and very clever so
so I eh I tried that and that was oh terribly strong but I did push past it it's funny it's a bit like drinking beer I never liked beer for years
no that's true
but I sort of I trained myself to do it by just trying it
okay
it's funny what you'll do in the cause of em sociability I suppose
did you have many friends that smoked?
eh yes yes a few
oh
there was a bit of peer pressure involved
mm
so I took up cigarettes after a year or two of pipe smoking
okay
you've never smoked though have you?
well em not
ah I'm gonna get a confession now

and em I didn't mind it I'd sort of take other people's cigarettes and have a drag and I kinda quite
mm
like almost sort of liked it and then if I went to parties or something then I might just sort of take some cigarette and have a drag and and that was it
well I didn't know that
and I kind eh well I know but I didn't know you then I kind of liked it and then I was in Italy em and then I I did that one night and then I inhaled oh my god I nearly died
so that was the end of that I think oh and then when I was in Poland I em my friends had these cigarettes that cost the equivalent of forty P a packet so you can imagine what they were like
lovely
em yeah so that was but I think that was the last eh the last time I actually tried a cigarette
it was a cigar wasn't it?
was eh was yeah on our wedding day when I tried your cigar and it was revolting so yeah that was my experience of smoking

what my my preferred vice?
yeah presumably not smoking?

not smoking em well I've never really been interested in in drugs so cos I don't well I'm gonna contradict myself here I was going to say I don't like the idea of a mind-altering substance cos I'd like to be in control but then I was going to say alcohol
right

so I would love to be able to think oh you can drink not not to getting really drunk but I think now you you just have to you know after every glass of wine you have to think ooh I shouldn't do this I shouldn't do that and I thought oh I just wish if that was removed so you could have I don't know half a bottle of wine a night
do you find it has more more or less of an effect as you get older?
em probably more
yeah I think so
I think I had I think but there are I think the trouble is though that alcohol is is well wine is em is stronger new world wine is stronger and em
well that's just
and that stuff that's fifteen percent the stuff we just had
it's not us getting weaker then as we get older
Well it is a bit of both
yeah I think

I think it is a bit of both and I think if you I think if you're the trouble is that if you're tired you need a lot of sleep but of course wine although or any alcohol although it it sends you off to sleep quite quickly initially it it stops you I think it stops you having good regular sort of deep sleep patterns so you wake up in the middle of the night and need to go to the loo or need a drink of water or whatever
yeah it makes you thirsty

whereas and also I think that em because the trend is to drink more wine with things like red wine you have all the congealers and and things that I think can give you more of a headache whereas if you have
mm

something like gin or vodka I think that ob obviously it's still got the alcohol effect but I think the whole sort of fuzzy head thing is less likely to happen so yes if it had no if it had no effect on your health then yes I'd love to be able to sort of drink a social amount of alcohol let's say I do and how how brilliant would it be to drink and not have to worry about driving?
ah that would be handy
what if you could drink and and it it could relax you but it you could still drive? That would be so cool because we could go out to restaurants and things
yeah
and not have to worry about thirty pounds for a taxi

that's right it would save money on taxis and it's so annoying when other people are having fun and you're not I mean you can have fun but it there's a certain point when people have been drinking and they're laughing so much more easily than normal and you're sitting there going mm that wasn't so funny
yeah yeah there's nothing worse than being really sober in front of loads of people a bit squiffy mm
but you don't get in the mood no I hate that it's a bit annoying but yeah you should probably get used to it and you know around here you have to drive don't you?
yeah

so you can get drunk
well yeah I know but I I always think that sounds really really immature I'd rather have something that I like the taste of

but anyway should we do you do you ask me one of your questions
okay which is more important intelligence or common sense?

or cross the road or certainly they're poor at social skills aren't they? Traditionally

but what's that then?
businesses would run so much smoothly what do you mean?
what's that common sense or intelligence?

as opposed to thinking of greater for example if em when I think of intelligence I think of people who are maybe sort of quite academic who can ap ah who can apply who can apply stuff em like someone like my dad who's very he can he can learn he can learn stuff sort of by rote but he can't apply it at all
so how do those terms apply to him?

em well what I'm thinking of obviously not very clearly is that to me intelligence is something that is more academic that is a is a higher level it is thinking of say for example em when you start reading between the line or if you're if you're studying literature and you start looking at symbolism and y you're you kind of have to lo look for things that isn't look for things that aren't sort of staring at you

and you have to almost make deductions about things mainly

probably wouldn't live nearly as long we'd be dead by now probably

em but there another oh yeah this morning I was watching em your favourite darling Big Fat Gypsy Weddings and em it was talking about who gypsies who had married non-gypsies and how some of their relationships work and some of them haven't cos they have in their in the gypsy culture it's a very you know the women stay at home look after the they look after the children they and they clean they clean all the time the men sort of are real men they drink and they fight you know eh deal with horses and stuff and I kind of thought from watching it I thought the relationships which are most likely to work is when you have a gypsy marrying a non a gypsy woman marrying a non-gypsy man because a a a non-gypsy man probably isn't gonna be too worried about a woman that wants to stay at home and look after the children and clean a lot
no he'd be jolly glad probably

oh yeah
gypsy woman
yes

yeah that wouldn't work
never change a nappy and and not be present at the birth of a child and all the rest of it I think that would be harder
